definition[0]: someone who is passive tends to accept things that happen to them or things that people say to them, without taking any action
example[0]: Kathy seems to take a very passive role in the relationship.
example[1]: their passive acceptance of their fate
definition[1]: a passive verb or sentence has as its subject the person or thing to which an action is done, as in ‘His father was killed in a car accident.’
definition[2]: passive investment activities are those in which the investor does not take part in making management decisions in the company they invest in, for example by being on its BOARD
example[2]: The New Jersey Casino Control Commission is considering changing its rule limiting passive institutional investing.
definition[3]: passive electronic equipment, machines etc do not contain electrical power and are therefore only able to receive signals, not send them
example[3]: The invention improves the video capability ofpassive liquid crystal displays.
definition[4]: passive investing is when an investor buys shares and waits for their value to increase over a long period of time, rather than often buying and selling shares as their value changes
example[4]: Passive investing requires good initial research, patience, and a well-diversified portfolio.
